title: Poacher's has been useless for the entire season

replies.body: It has, outside of the occasional really niche use. Odds are high we'll remove it come preseason when we do an item pass (updating, adding, removing various items).

Just straight out remove it? I'm going to go off the assumption that you have had ideas for Poacher, but none that work out quite as you would want them too, but to just straight off remove seems... hasty, at best?

We wanted to try an item that really clearly telegraphed your intent to counter jungle a lot, with power loaded into the action of counter jungling specifically (as opposed to an item that's good for counterjungling, but also has other uses, like boots). Conclusion at this point is that that's too narrow a space for an item, given its tendency to lead to one jungler or the other failing really hard early. We want early actions to matter, but not to effectively decide games, and Poacher's risks games snowballing too hard too fast for one team or the other.

>We wanted to try an item that really clearly telegraphed your intent to counter jungle a lot

There's your problem right there. If I'm going to be counterjungling I'd prefer not to put up a neon sign telling the enemy team.

Then get purple smite and be done with it. They put it in as a high risk (you telegraph your strategy) high reward (you steal their jungle and get bonuses) item, and he just admitted it turns out it is too high risk to be viable. Instead they'll just remove it and try to find another way to support counter-jungling behavior.

If you're actually going to counterjungle Red smite is optimal. Assuming the enemy jungler is weaker than you (they should be if you're counterjungling) you can just turn around and fight them if they find you. It's actually a stronger counterjungling item than White smite.

The fact that there is contention on this point means that there is, indeed, more than one path to counterjungling.

I think that something like 25-50% bonus time or something like that from buffs on enemys jungle would be nice. More time with red/blue/gromp/golem buff, more time to destroy wards or more time with wolf vision. And keep bonus gold and MS.

Any other item on the chopping block that we should be aware of?

And honestly, I am not mourning Stalker Blade's passing, Counterjungling just shouldn't be reliably applicable. There is nothing more miserable than getting successfully counterjungled, and the counterjungler rarely pays any price for focusing on counterjungling you, since you have to double down on recouping your losses, while they have free reign to gank with little fear of retribution.

None as clear cut as Poacher's. We're experimenting with a lot of stuff at present, it'll be a while though before most of that's solid enough to talk about usefully though. 

One thing I will mention, since I've seen it requested a lot, is that we're looking at a reworked version of Executioner's Calling (AD Grevious Wounds item). Way too early to make any promises it'll necessarily be coming back, it is one of the things we're looking into though.

So what are you thoughts on Grevious wounds in general?
People have noticed the removal of it on champs, but does it have a place in the game?

Current thinking is that Grevious Wounds serves a useful function keeping healing/regen in check, but that we may not have been offering it in the right ways. For starters the % may not be right, - 50% is such a larger difference that characters with strong healing end up being really feast or famine depending on whether they're facing GW or not. Shifting to a lower %, and reducing healing/regen amounts somewhat, might be more appropriate.

As far as GW on individual champions goes we've stripped it off a number of champions because of the amount if felt like some match ups were decided in champion select. We're still talking though about whether there are some good spots for GW on champion kits (e.g. is the problem regular application of GW in lane, rather than GW on kits in general).

Why not just make GW a scaling stat?

For example, {{champion:110}} 's E could reduce healing by 20% + 10% bonus AD (Just an example, don't really mind the numbers)
So Varus' GW might be fine considering you can leave the area to lose the debuff and continue fighting, where MF's old GW could only be "countered" by disengaging entirely and waiting?

Have you explored other ways of handling healing? 

I remember a PvP focused MMO, I think it was called Fury or Rage or something people think when they go "grr", but every time you got healed, the next heal within x seconds was reduced by 10%. Stacked up to 10 times to a full reduction. A bit of a difference though as that game's resource system was a lot difference(4 elements, you'd use one ability to charge the element,then another to consume). Wasn't horrible, had it's down sides though. 

Back on point on this though. What if healing in league reduced further healing by 5%, stacking up to 5 times. Then make GW double this debuff. Keeping the full 50% as a possibility but situatonal. 

Problem comes from special effects like Janna's R, Swain's R, Vlad's everything. Champions who's kit is based on or have a lot of repeated healing. 

------

Another one, which I personally really like, is a "gray health" mechanic. Works just like Tahm. Taking damage leaves a bar of the missing HP. 

After this reduce all base healing by whatever the balance teams says to. Then give all heals the ability to heal "x" more of this gray health.

I really like this because it makes healing a little more reactionary instead of passive like it currently is. Sooner you heal, the more your heal is worth. If you just sit in the back, it's going to cost you more mana(or HP for Soraka). 

A lot can be done with this. You can make a champion like Soraka who already costs her own HP to heal, have a better base heal but less gray heal. Nami's heal could be the same for all bounces, but the %ap change could factor off gray healing. 

Can go further with items. SV could increase the gray health left or reduce the decay. Warmog's could grant it's passive to gray health even if in combat(probably need nerfed though). Spell vamp could be buffed but have a larger focus on gray health. 

GW could increase the decay/reduce the gray health left. 

---

Last one is a ward. It'll share a slot with pink wards. Have 3 HP. Does not stealth. But applies GW around it in a large area. A lot of down sides could come of this "anti-healing in a pocket". But I could see Riot rolling with it and making something interesting. Or just items with actives in general. Like FQC. Which is considered the weakest support item. What if it's active gave the debuff?

I suggest placing a soft cap on healing received. Let me try to explain: If you have less than 100% hp (1000/2000) you can get healed up to 50% of your missing  health (500, up to 1500/2000). Any further damage will not cause your health cap to decrease until you are brought to a lower hp than you were before first being healed (you will be able to heal back to 1500 until you get damaged below 1000 hp; say... 800 hp. Then you will be able to be healed up to a maximum of 1400 hp).

TL;DR: You can heal back 1 point of hp for every 2 points you lose, until the teamfight ends
Why can't we have different amounts, like for slows?

I remember some time ago (probably last year) some Rioter said that if GW is needed in the meta then it's probably because healings aren't balanced, so they'd rather look at healings and champs with large heals rather than push GW (i'll try to find the post again).
